# Category Management Feature
## Overview Added a complete category management system to allow administrators to create, update, and delete product categories before adding products.
## Problem Solved Previously, administrators could not add products without selecting a category, but there was no UI or functionality to manage categories. This feature resolves that issue.
## Implementation Details
### 1. Database Layer (DAO) **File: `CategoryDAO.java`**
Added the following methods: - `createCategory(Category category)` - Create a new category - `updateCategory(Category category)` - Update an existing category - `deleteCategory(int categoryId)` - Delete a category by ID - `categoryNameExists(String categoryName)` - Check if a category name already exists (prevents duplicates)
### 2. Service Layer **File: `CategoryService.java`**
Added service methods that wrap the DAO methods: - `createCategory(Category category)` - `updateCategory(Category category)` - `deleteCategory(int categoryId)` - `categoryNameExists(String categoryName)`
### 3. User Interface **File: `admin_view.fxml`**
Restructured the admin view to use a tabbed interface: - **Products Tab**: Original product management interface - **Categories Tab**: New category management interface with: - Table displaying all categories (ID, Name, Description) - Form fields for category details - Add, Update, Delete, and Clear Form buttons
### 4. Controller **File: `AdminController.java`**
Added category management functionality: - FXML bindings for category table and form fields - `showCategoryDetails(Category category)` - Display selected category in form - `handleAddCategory()` - Add new category with duplicate name checking - `handleUpdateCategory()` - Update selected category - `handleDeleteCategory()` - Delete selected category with confirmation dialog - `handleClearCategory()` - Clear the category form - `isCategoryInputValid()` - Validate category input - `showSuccessAlert()` - Display success messages
## Usage Flow
### Adding a Category 1. Open the admin view 2. Navigate to the "Categories" tab 3. Enter category name and description 4. Click "Add" button 5. The category will appear in the table and become available in the product category dropdown
### Updating a Category 1. Select a category from the table 2. Modify the name or description in the form 3. Click "Update" button 4. Changes are saved to the database
### Deleting a Category 1. Select a category from the table 2. Click "Delete" button 3. Confirm the deletion in the dialog 4. Category is removed (note: may fail if products are using this category)
### Adding Products Now that categories can be managed: 1. Add at least one category in the Categories tab 2. Navigate to the Products tab 3. The category dropdown will be populated with available categories 4. Select a category and add your product
## Features - **Duplicate Prevention**: System checks for duplicate category names before adding - **Validation**: Ensures category name is not empty - **Confirmation Dialogs**: Warns users before deleting categories - **User Feedback**: Success and error messages for all operations - **Seamless Integration**: Category changes immediately reflect in product management
## Technical Notes - Uses JavaFX TableView for category display - Implements Observer pattern for table selection - Maintains separation of concerns (DAO → Service → Controller) - Follows existing code patterns and conventions
